Description: Three fragments dark brown human hair cord and one of string used as binding. A knot joins two of the fragments and another fragment contains three knots. There are two different weave structures, each one attached on two different fragments. The string consists of 5 's'-spun yarns, 'z'-plied. The cord consists of 2 's'-spun elements, 'z'-plied or 3 'z'- spun elements, plied into a 's'-cord.
Bibliographic references: Adams et al 1999 / Kulubnarti III: The Cemeteries (p. 63)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Dr William Yewdale Adams
Donated by: W S Webb Museum of Anthropology (University of Kentucky)
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: 93.2.49C (excavation object cat. no.)
